title: How to Make Crock Pot Chili With Dried Beans

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Brown the beef in the skillet.
steps.description: Use a spatula to break it up into pieces as it cooks. Continue browning the beef and breaking it up until it's cooked.

steps.headline: Remove the beef to a plate.
Dice the green and red peppers.
Place all the ingredients in the crock pot.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients.
Place the lid on the pot.
Cook the chili on high for 6 - 8 hours.
Serve the chili.
steps.description: When it's finished, it will have a deep brownish red hue. Serve with fresh chopped onions and crackers or tortilla chips.

steps.headline: Make white bean crock pot chili.
steps.description: This delicious variation on crock pot chili uses ground turkey instead of ground beef. Replace the kidney beans and pinto beans with great northern beans, and use plenty of green chiles.

steps.headline: Make Texas crock pot chili.
steps.description: You can skip the beans altogether and use 2 pound of chopped sirloin steak instead of ground beef. Slow cook the meat and vegetables until the meat is fall-apart tender.

steps.headline: Make  vegetarian crock pot chili.
steps.description: Replace the ground beef with an extra cup of black beans, and add carrots, celery, sweet potatoes, and any other vegetables you love to eat. Cover the chili ingredients with vegetable broth instead of water. After 6 - 8 hours of cooking, your vegetarian chili will be deliciously rich.

text: Preparing the Ingredients Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Brown the beef in the skillet. Use a spatula to break it up into pieces as it cooks. Continue browning the beef and breaking it up until it's cooked. Remove the beef to a plate.  Dice the onion.  Dice the green and red peppers.  Mince the garlic.  Cooking the Chili Place all the ingredients in the crock pot.  Add enough water to cover the ingredients.  Place the lid on the pot.  Cook the chili on high for 6 - 8 hours.  Serve the chili. When it's finished, it will have a deep brownish red hue. Serve with fresh chopped onions and crackers or tortilla chips. Trying Variations Make white bean crock pot chili. This delicious variation on crock pot chili uses ground turkey instead of ground beef. Replace the kidney beans and pinto beans with great northern beans, and use plenty of green chiles. Make Texas crock pot chili. You can skip the beans altogether and use 2 pound of chopped sirloin steak instead of ground beef. Slow cook the meat and vegetables until the meat is fall-apart tender. Make  vegetarian crock pot chili. Replace the ground beef with an extra cup of black beans, and add carrots, celery, sweet potatoes, and any other vegetables you love to eat. Cover the chili ingredients with vegetable broth instead of water. After 6 - 8 hours of cooking, your vegetarian chili will be deliciously rich. Finished.
